intro: Tetracera surinamensis var. reticulata, commonly known as the reticulated tetracera, is a climbing shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with a distinctive reticulate venation pattern. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
